title: Humpe Sisters Projects - (Neue Deeutsche Welle ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“NDW)
description:
Another somewhat overlooked music scene of the 70s and 80s was German New
Wave (Neue Deeutsche Welle ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“NDW) Most of these artists sang in their native
language of German. Though these artists were extremely popular in the
German speaking areas of Europe, some never made a dent in the English
speaking regions. Naively, most of these bands are categorized in that so
called "One Hit Wonder" category that Americans use ignorantly and
egocentrically for U.K. & European Artists that only have one "hit" in the
US. Most of these so called "One Hit Wonder" bands have multiple hits as well as Gold & Platinum record sales around the world. Many of the artists are still
making music 20 or 30 years later.

    Some of the most popular Artists of that scene are Nena, Falco, Peter Schilling, Trio, DAF, Hubert Kah, and Nina Hagen. Sadly, one of the most
talented individuals that is often overlooked in the Western World is
Annette Humpe and her sister Inga Humpe. They have been in some of the
biggest bands of the German New Wave scene ever; Ideal, Neonbabies, DOF,
Humpe Humpe, and Swimming With Sharks.

(Note: DOF was intended as a comedy album, but had a monstrous music hit
with Codo.)
